newsitem.title: USA: AmeriQuest to cut labor, sees year loss.
newsitem.headline: AmeriQuest to cut labor, sees year loss.

text.p: AmeriQuest Technologies Inc said Wednesday its losses for the year ending September 30 could be in the range of about $45 million, with about $25 million coming in charges for a planned restructuring.
The company said it is also probing the possible disposition of business segments and other assets.

The company said revenues for the quarter ended March 31 were substantially below expectations and blamed its woes on its inability "to compete effectively in the standard distribution of computer products."
First Call estimates for the company were not immediately available, but the company reported a net loss of more than $33.6 million for the fiscal year ended September 30, 1996.

The company said it plans to cut its work force and close facilities over the next several months with the goal of strengthening its Advanced Systems Group, a unit that distributes high-end workstations and servers.

AmeriQuest said the group has the highest gross margins of its distribution businesses. It said the group has been profitable on an operating basis before corporate overhead allocations but would need a substantial increase in sales to achieve profitability on a stand-alone basis.
Additionally, the company said its board has approved in principle a preferred stock purchase agreement that should provide an investment of $30 million.
